random_doc:
A defiantly odd thriller involving esoteric subject matter, The Hummingbird Project tells a familiar story of ambition and greed with enough eccentricity that the movie’s strangeness becomes one of its chief attributes. Jesse Eisenberg and Alexander Skarsgård commit fully as cousins hell-bent on getting rich in the stock market by building a super-fast cross-country fibre-optic cable — a quest that proves more challenging for them and far wonkier for the audience than initially expected. And yet, writer-director Kim Nguyen’s faith in his weird, cynical vision proves sufficiently compelling, even when the characters’ peculiarities turn tiresome.
Premiering at the Toronto Film Festival, the movie will benefit from the star power of Eisenberg and Skarsgård, not to mention a villainous turn from Salma Hayek. Hummingbird’s juggling of genres — thriller, heist movie, family drama, character study, social commentary — may attract adventurous viewers, although it could prove challenging to marketers trying to condense the film into a poster.
Eisenberg plays Vincent, who convinces his computer-savvy cousin Anton (Skarsgård) that they should quit their jobs at a high-powered New York trading company, run by Eva Torres (Hayek), to go into business for themselves. Their plan: construct a thin but reliable cable that runs from Kansas to New Jersey that can receive trading information milliseconds faster than the competition, allowing them and their clients to make millions.
For those not familiar with high-frequency trading or other aspects of the stock market, Hummingbird refuses to simplify its characters’ milieu. But the strategy pays off for Nguyen (War Witch), who in some ways wants Vincent and Anton’s plan to be abstruse, underlining how in our modern age untold fortunes can be acquired simply by accessing data a millisecond faster. There’s an unreality to their scheme — just random numbers on a computer screen — that speaks to the cold efficiency of the operation.
Further highlighting the joylessness of their ambition is a series of bizarre obstacles that cross their paths, including nervous investors, obstinate land owners who don’t want cable laid under their property, problems with Anton’s computations to shave a single millisecond off their system’s data speed, and an unexpected serious illness. And that’s not even accounting for Eva, who fights back by devising a counter-strategy that will potentially render their new cable obsolete.
In films like The Social Network, Eisenberg has depicted driven, not wholly likable protagonists, and so his work as Vincent may not feel that far removed from past portrayals. But as Hummingbird rolls along, the depth of Vincent’s relentless ambition becomes starker, and the Oscar-nominated actor unapologetically reveals his character’s every desperate, devious tendency, resulting in a brazen performance that willingly strains credibility. And yet, Eisenberg’s tight jaw and dark eyes communicate all the hidden reasons why he needs this plan to work.
If anything, Skarsgård is even more over-the-top as a socially awkward programmer who has spent most of his life being browbeaten by his cousin. Anton’s objectives seem less materialistic than Vincent’s — he just wants to design a superior product — but although Anton’s quirky behaviour can feel invented rather than organic, Skarsgård’s vulnerability elicits our sympathy.
Hayek has a blast as Hummingbird’s antagonist, pumping as much life into Eva’s cartoon-y lines as she can. Like Vincent and Anton, she operates in a world in which millions of dollars are at stake — although everything is so theoretical that those unseen fortunes could simply be a figment of their imagination. As the double-crosses and twists unspool, Nguyen very consciously seems to be commenting on the ugliness that emerges in people when money is on the line. The Hummingbird Project teaches that old lesson in a strange, new (and mostly satisfying) way.

Write a 500-word creative story: 1. Imagine you are a young man named Peter. One day you go to the countryside and see an old man sitting by the gate. He looks sad. Walk up to the old man and speak to him. What does he tell you? 2. Imagine you are a girl called Helen. One day you visit a friend in hospital. The doctor tells you that your friend is ill. What is the illness and how do you know your friend is ill? 3. Imagine you are a policeman or policewoman. You receive a call from a taxi driver who says he is being threatened by three men in a pub. What are the three men doing and what do you do when you arrive in the pub?

The best way to think of a plot is as a question and an answer. The question is the conflict or tension in the story. What happens to make the character sad? What will happen to make him happy again? A plot needs a character, a setting, and a problem. It also needs to have a beginning, middle, and end. The best plots are interesting and make the reader want to know what will happen next.

A plot consists of three phases. These are: the exposition (which is the introduction, or setting of the scene), the development (where something happens to change the original state of affairs), and the resolution (where the conflict or problem is resolved). These three phases should be written in that order. However, the first phase should be the last phase that you write because you need the middle phase(s) to plan the other two.

There are many kinds of plots. These include action, adventure, mystery, or romantic plots. The type of plot you choose depends on what type of story you are writing. If you are writing a story about someone's feelings, then you will choose a romantic plot. If you are writing a detective story, then you will choose a mystery plot. An action plot is based around action (i.e. the main character is in danger and must try to escape), and an adventure plot is based around travelling and meeting new people and having new experiences.

The most important thing to remember when you are writing your story is to write in your own words. That way, the reader will be able to tell what kind of person you are and what you believe in. You can do this by using words that have a certain meaning to you, or by using lots of adjectives and similes to describe things

The Mark Twain Circle of America, in coordination with the Center for Mark Twain Studies, is calling for proposals for two sessions at the upcoming American Literature Association annual conference, scheduled for May 25-28, 2023, in Boston. The Circle invites innovative proposals on all topics that engage with Mark Twain and Mark Twain Studies.
We are especially interested in the work of emerging scholars and in perspectives that challenge existing paradigms and assumptions about Mark Twain’s life, his work, and his legacy.

random_doc:
Some employers and employees mistakenly believe that the provision of a new Employee Handbook and a signed acknowledgement form is akin to a new employee-employer contract or agreement. This has proven not to be the case in multiple court cases. Providing an employee handbook to your existing employees usually lacks the contract law “basics” of offer/acceptance, consideration, and intention. Employers should realize that for the most part, employee handbooks are not enforceable in the same manner as an employment contract. See this First Reference article about handbook enforceability.
Some employers will write and attach the employee handbook into the employment contract for new employees. This would be an example of an employee handbook with a better chance of being enforced – but employer beware, this would not extend to any updates to the handbook.
Statements like this help the employee and the employer use the handbook for its proper purposes rather than as a substitute for clearly written and enforceable employment contracts.
Have you seen or read your organizations operation manual or policy and procedure manual? Depending on the organization, these are massive, detailed, regulatory, legal and procedural virtual encyclopedias of every aspect of your organization.
Organizations need these detailed policies and procedures to guide the organization in consistent and compliant practices specific to the organization, the industry and regulatory requirements. The policy and procedure manual (sometimes also called an operations manual) functions as a tool for managers and supervisors and usually provides a reference to any regulatory requirements. The operations manual should be located in an accessible location or on the company intranet. All employees (or at a minimum managers and supervisors) should have access to this document – but it is not a document that all employees will read. For an example of a human resources policy and procedure manual see the print and electronic version of Human Resources PolicyPro available from First Reference.
If you create an employee handbook without having a policy and procedure manual, your employee handbook will be too cumbersome and legalistic. If you create a quick and easy to read employee handbook with no operations manual as a back-up – you risk inconsistent application and understanding of the material in the employee handbook.
The best employee handbooks are provided for informational purposes. They should provide employees with clearly written, well organized and generalized summaries of the organizational materials such as: organizational mission, vision and values, the operations manual, employment policies, vacation policies, hours of work, regulatory policies, employee benefits and much more. But not too much more because you want employees to read the whole handbook from cover to cover!
Employee handbook is consistent in tone with the mission, vision and values that your organization wants to convey to all staff and all customers.
Policies referenced in employee handbook are compliant and updated to current legislation.
Policies referenced in employee handbook are congruent with operations manual or policies and procedures manual.
Employee handbook is concise.
Employee handbook is updated on a regular basis and old versions are replaced.
Handbook is available to all employees onsite and online.
All employees have been given a copy of the employee handbook and acknowledgement forms for handbook are kept on file.
Meetings held with employees to provide opportunity for feedback and questions regarding the handbook.
Finally, please remember, your employee handbook exists for your employees as much as it does for your organization. A clear and straightforward employee handbook is a great tool to demonstrate your organizations consistency, fairness and transparency to the whole team. It is well worth taking the time to create your employee handbook internally in order to create your team’s unique “playbook” to get everyone onside and working together.

random_doc:
Welcome to the back and core foam roller page!
Looking to improve back flexibility? What about adding some new core exercises to your golf strength training program? Add a roller!
A foam roller is not only a great way to perform myofascial release in the extremities, but it also can be used to supplement what you are already doing for your back and core. I have found a handful of solid exercises that I use frequently in the clinic and I will present them here.
While rollers can be very beneficial to some people, keep in mind that they are not for everyone. If you have hip or knee problems and have a hard time getting down or up from the floor, you will have trouble using them. If you have any significant back or neck condition, it is probably a good idea to consult a healthcare professional familiar with rollers prior to starting.
  Now, walk back and forth with your legs, with the roller traveling from your tailbone to your shoulder blades and back.
Rotation Stretch - With this exercise, you are going to lay on the foam roller with it perfectly in line with your spine, meaning that your tailbone will be at one end and your head will be able to rest on the other end. Bend your knees to about 90 degrees and have your knees and feet together, with the feet resting on the ground. Now rotate your legs together to one side, but rotate your neck to the other so that you are getting a stretch along the entire spine. Repeat to the other side.
Dying Bug - Start by laying on top of the roller with it in line with your spine. Have your knees bent and your arms resting on the floor away from your body. Start by bending your left hip and then reach and touch your left knee with your right hand. Contact should be made around stomach/chest level. Return to starting position and then repeat with right leg and left hand.
Lift and Hold - Start by laying on top of the roller with it in line with your spine. Have knees bent and arms resting on the ground at your side. Bend your hips up to a 90 degree angle. Your knees and ankles should also be at 90 degree angles. Balance on the roller and hold this position for 5-10 seconds. Return to resting position.
Bicycles - Start in the same position as Lift and Hold with hips,knees,and ankle elevated and at 90 degree angles. While balancing on the roller, slowly extend your right leg while keeping the left bent. Return the right leg to elevated position, then extend the left leg.

random_doc:
We all have faced a situation where the not so tech savy friends and relatives of ours have called us and asked us to suggest them a laptop or pc configuration. Some of them have an idea about their budget, some don’t. The cash majority of times doesn’t match their work usage. This is a very short post on how this and the ever so changing and obsolete computer technology also puts us in a quandry over the same.
In the nov of 2017, I paid a total of 30,000/- for a pc configuration of a Core I 5 7th gen processor, Gigabyte motherboard capable of holding a Nvidia GTX 1030 graphics card and a 64 bit Windows 10. The ram was a 4 gb from corsair and also came a ATX cabinet and SMPS by iball. The ram could be expanded later on . I already had a monitor, a seagate internal hdd and a sony dvd writer. Graphics card was due to the future use of processing DSLR photos on lightroom ( which already took 4 gb ram as standard use). In late 2019, when I finally decided to use lightroom I had to upgrade the ram to 8 gb (which costed me some money via exchange) so that I don’t face any type of stutter. So you see that the configuration is more than enough and powerful for simple use and wont require any major upgrades for many years to come unless either of the processor or the motherboard conks out.
Compare this to June 2020 when I had to go to the computer market to get the price for an assembled pc unit for someone. His configuration includes a Core I 5 9th gen processor, gigabyte motherboard, Nvidia GTX 1030, 8 GB ram, I ball cabinet and SMPS, a 22” Samsung monitor, 1 TB hdd , DVD writer. All this is costing him under 40,000/- .
So you can see how fast technology has become obsolete in just 2.5 years where in almost the same price you are getting much technologically advanced configuration, discounting the fact that these are the prices when the computer and its parts have become expensive after budget.
This post is a wake up call to all those who contact us to suggest them a configuration of pc or a laptop model. My laptop is a I 5 8th gen with 16 GB ram, graphics card. In 2018 it costed me 68000/- . Now a days for less than 50,000/- you can get a laptop with a hdd + ssd but without graphics card. For us, suggesting models / configuration is not easy as things are changing really fast and we can never suggest you a configuration which is always value for money as the budget would always be less than the hardware which is perfect for you. After every 30 months, tech changes by generations and if you are not careful, you might be fooled in buying outdated gadgets.

The door slammed open and in came the first gust of wind into the office. Mr. Brown’s office looked as disorganized as ever, with papers strewn across his desk and on the floor. Today, his work was going to be especially difficult, as the company was losing clients rapidly and would be going bankrupt soon. They would have to lay off staff if they didn’t find a way to generate income. His assistant walked in, and Mr. Brown asked her to get him a drink. He had not eaten since the last time he visited the cafeteria and was feeling a little thirsty. The assistant brought him a soda and asked him what he wanted for lunch, and he had an idea. What if he could use some leftover chips from an old ad campaign and somehow use them to fund the company’s budget?
He called his assistant, and told her to take the chips out of the refrigerator, open the back room door, and get the chips ready for the ad campaign. The chips had been sitting there for weeks, but they looked fresh, he thought. They would make a good meal for him, too. His assistant looked at the pile of chips and asked, “What will we do with the other chips, Mr. Brown?” Mr. Brown replied, “Don’t worry about that. Just get the chips ready for the ad campaign.”
Soon, the chips were out of the refrigerator and ready to go, as if they were ready to be eaten. He smiled and turned to his assistant, and said, “You did a great job. You must be very good at your job.” He went to the back room door, opened it, and got the chips ready for the ad campaign. In no time, they were out on the street, advertising the company’s services. His assistant looked out the window and watched the crowd grow around the chips as they started moving towards the company building. She laughed and said, “That’s good! They must be hungry!”
Mr. Brown called the receptionist and asked her if there were any more chips left in the refrigerator. The receptionist said no, so he told his assistant to call a catering company. Mr. Brown asked her if she could send the catering company over to the company building in an hour. She looked outside and saw the crowd of people eating the chips,

random_doc:
All Ceylon Hindu Congress (Federation of Hindu Religious Associations and Hindu Temples in Sri Lanka) was shocked and grieved to hear that 150 year old statue of Shri Muthumariamanan which was in Shri Murugan Kovil in Udunuwara in Hali Ela Badulla District had been damaged by undesirable criminal elements.
When such destructions and thefts were reported we brought those to the notice of the concerned persons and also to the appropriate authorities including His Excellency the President, the Secretary to the Defence Ministry and the IGP but those responsible for those criminal acts have not been arrested and brought before the Law. Such failure to take action appears to be encouraging those undesirable criminal elements to continue these criminal acts of destruction and thefts. Who is responsible for this unfortunate continuous dilemma to the Hindu People of this country and for the Divine statues being continuously destroyed and the valuable items being continuously stolen in the Hindu Temples?
Although the Hindus have expressed their shock and disappointment at the continuing illegal acts and expressed their dismay at these unfortunate happenings only to the places of worship of minorities the Government and the Officers responsible for law and order have failed to take steps to prevent those.
Therefore all the religious leaders and the political leaders should insist on the Government guaranteeing of cessation of these acts of injustice.
Although the State is to give Buddhism the foremost place it is also entrusted with another important duty by Article 9 of the Constitution to assure to all religions the rights of freedom and enjoyment with equality of those religions also, as enshrined in the Articles 10 and 14 (1) (e) of the Constitution. Failure to do so amounts to be an offence of insulting the Republican Constitution.
It cannot be the policy of the Government to allow the destruction of the Hindus and their places of worship and thus violates the Republican Constitution.

Write a 500-word creative story: The title of my story is "A Time for Reflection" Here we go with a story I wrote long ago in an effort to explore the meaning of the expression "a time to be thankful" during Thanksgiving week:

 A Time to be Thankful
A Time to be Thankful
One Thanksgiving the Grady Family decided to spend Thanksgiving week alone. Everyone else in the neighborhood were celebrating the holiday in their own way, but the Grady’s, had different plans.
They made the decision on Thursday, November 23, 2017 and told their neighbors. The neighbors decided they would have the same meal on the following day and that they would welcome the Grady’s over for dinner, on the 24th.
On Saturday morning the phone rang and Mrs. Grady was happy to hear her sister was coming to spend the holiday with them.
 She had come all the way from the West Coast and so Mrs. Grady told her sister would be over to the house after the Thanksgiving parade.
They decided they would have a wonderful meal on Saturday that would include: Turkey, Ham, Corned Beef, Sweet Potato’s, Collard Greens, Macaroni and Cheese, Mashed Potatoes, Yams with Brown sugar and Pecans, Canned Cranberry Sauce, Corn Bread, Corn on the Cob and a big pumpkin pie for dessert. They wanted to make a big menu of traditional favorites they could make easily and that everyone in the family would enjoy. 
When her sister arrived the two women began making the huge meal and everyone was busy in the kitchen. Then they stopped working to watch the parade on TV.
After dinner and dessert, the family went into the living room. They sat on the sofa and on reclining chairs. The TV was already tuned into a station that was playing an old black and white movie. The movie was about the beginning of WW I. 
 Mr. and Mrs. Grady’s youngest son watched it and Mrs. Grady’s sister watched it with him. The two of them were fascinated with the movie. They said it was as though they were sitting back in time while watching the old World War I era film. When the movie was over it was around 9:00 pm and the family decided it was time to say their prayers and get to bed.

The title of my story is "A Time for Reflection" Here we go with a story I wrote long ago in an effort to explore the meaning of the expression "a time to be thankful" during Thanksgiving week:

 A Time to be Thankful
A Time to be Thankful
One Thanksgiving the Grady Family decided to spend Thanksgiving week alone. Everyone else in the neighborhood were celebrating the holiday in their own way, but the Grady’s, had different plans.
They made the decision on Thursday, November 23, 2017 and told their neighbors. The neighbors decided they would have the same meal on the following day and that they would welcome the Grady’s over for dinner, on the 24th.
On Saturday morning the phone rang and Mrs. Grady was happy to hear her sister was coming to spend the holiday with them.
 She had come all the way from the West Coast and so Mrs. Grady told her sister would be over to the house after the Thanksgiving parade.
They decided they would have a wonderful meal on Saturday that would include: Turkey, Ham, Corned Beef, Sweet Potato’s, Collard Greens, Macaroni and Cheese, Mashed Potatoes, Yams with Brown sugar and Pecans, Canned Cranberry Sauce, Corn Bread, Corn on the Cob and a big pumpkin pie for dessert. They wanted to make a big menu of traditional favorites they could make easily and that everyone in the family would enjoy. 
When her sister arrived the two women began making the huge meal and everyone was busy in the kitchen. Then they stopped working to watch the parade on TV.
After dinner and dessert, the family went into the living room. They sat on the sofa and on reclining chairs. The TV was already tuned into a station that was playing an old black and white movie. The movie was about the beginning of WW I. 
 Mr. and Mrs. Grady’s youngest son watched it and Mrs. Grady’s sister watched it with him. The two of them were fascinated with the movie. They said it was as though they were sitting back in time while watching the old World War I era film. When the movie was over it was around 9:00 pm and the family decided it was time to say their prayers and get to bed. 
 In the morning Mrs. Grady’s sister and nephew went out into the garden and raked up the pine needles and grass clippings

Maps of Fiji starts with Fiji relative to the rest of the world. Yes, it's a tiny speck in a vast ocean.
It is centrally located in the south of the the world's biggest ocean, the Pacific Ocean.
It lies about two thirds of the distance from Hawaii to Australia or to New Zealand. Therefore, it's a popular stopover destination when travelling through the South Pacific.
The second part is the map of the archipelago of Fiji itself.
Fiji (sometimes known as the Fiji Islands) is comprised of 332 islands and over an additional 500 islets. Sparsely spread over a vast area of 1.3 million sq km, less than 1.5% is land area.
Fiji's islands are divided into 9 Fiji islands/island groups.
From the biggest island to the smallest (a couple of meters in diameter), there's a deserted patch of paradise for everyone.
It's an interactive map, so play around. See if you can find the tiny gorgeous islands with the resorts hidden away (Fiji island resorts)!
There shouldn't be a real need of obtaining a map while you are in Fiji, unless you're a geography buff like my dad.
One reason could be if you wanted to explore via car. In this case you can obtain a map via your rental company or from the tours desk at your resort. Speaking from experience, on Viti Levu in any case, the roads and directions are fairly simple to navigate, especially with a satellite navigation system onboard.
If you going on a tour, in almost all cases, you'll be picked up from your resort lobby. So, all the worry is taken out on getting to, and coming back from, your destination.

Get all your waste paper and start making a ball of it

Put the ball of waste paper in your saucepan

The Guideposts for Success are a framework to assist the multiple organizations that need to be involved to meet the needs and improve the transition outcomes of all youth including youth with disabilities and to create necessary community webs of support.
The Guideposts for Employer Success provides a framework for what the workforce development system can do to address employers’ needs with regard to hiring any job applicant, as well as additional needs employers may have in hiring and retaining employees with disabilities. The Guideposts for Employer Success are organized with the explicit purpose of helping workforce development policy makers and program providers reduce identified barriers. There are two categories within the framework. The first focuses on what system designers (state and local) need to do. The second looks at what individual programs which include a wide array of education and training institutions such as community rehabilitation centers, secondary and post secondary institutions, apprenticeship programs, and One-Stop Centers need to do.

Dokky creates a website and code documentation by reading a project's source code for comments. Aims to also be a markdown converter as well.

Creates a reference and home page for all source files in the code.
# Requirements
The only 3rd party python library required is Jinja2. 
- **Jinja2**: https://jinja.palletsprojects.com/en/2.11.x/
    - ```pip install -U jinja2```

# Usage

1. You must comment any functions that you wish to add to be parsed into documentation. Comment denotion can be customised further in the configuration file.
2. Create a configuration file (can be called anything), that follows the following structure:

**Configuration File Structure**
```json
{
    "config": {
        "includeDirectory": ,// The directory of the source code to parse.
        "outputDirectory": ,// The output directory of the documentation.
        "commentDenotion": ,// Specify what is considered a comment.
        "filterList": ,// Specify what file extensions are to be scanned.
        "language": ,// Specify the language of the source code.
        "repository": ,// Specify the GitHub repository of the source code.
    }
}
```

**Example Configuration File Based On Atomic (My Project)**
```json
{
    "config": {
        "includeDirectory": "C:/Dev/C++/Atomic/include",
        "outputDirectory": "./docs",
        "commentDenotion": "//",
        "filterList": [".hpp" ],
        "language": "cpp",
        "repository": "https://github.com/james-d12/Atomic"
    }
}
```

3. Once you've added comments open up a terminal to where 'Dokky.py' is located and run the following command.  
```python ./Dokky.py {config_file_path} ```

random_doc:
As part of the Gender and Development-Focal Point System’s (GAD-FPS) continued promotion on the relevance of women on empowerment, gender equality, and issues confronting women in the agri-fishery sector, employees from the Philippine Council for Agriculture and Fisheries (PCAF) conducted a virtual screening and discussion on the film titled “Sol Searching” on July 2, 2021.
The film highlights issues and challenges being faced by women, how they responded to these issues that feature the rights and roles of women, as well as the role they play in our society.
The story revolves around Sol Dolores, a grade school teacher who teaches farming in her community. When Sol died, her family went the extra mile to source out fundings for her burial. Aside from issues and concerns in gender and agriculture, the film also underscored various problems in the society faced by Sol and how she brought change to her environment despite her misforgivings.
In her opening message, PCAF OIC Executive Director Julieta Opulencia thanked Pinoy Indie Films Road Show (PIFRS) for bringing quality films that not only promotes local film makers but also depicts the issues being faced by women in their families and society in a creative way.
Meanwhile, Karen Salutan- Founder/Owner of PIFRS Multimedia Distribution Services who was also present in the event thanked PCAF for providing an avenue where they can promote locally produced independent films.
“I am advocating the promotion of indie films because most of the time, they are underpromoted and unnoticed due to the boom of commercially produced films which have more funding and have famous actors and actresses as part of the cast,” Salutan added.
After the virtual screening, a question and answer session was conducted where PCAF employees shared their thoughts and reflections on the film which was followed by a closing message from Conchita del Rosario, representative of the GAD-FPS and OIC Assistant Chief of the Partnership Development Division.
In her message, del Rosario reminded the participants of the objective of GAD which is to empower the underprivileged, disadvantaged, marginalized, and vulnerable groups.

As part of the Gender and Development-Focal Point System’s (GAD-FPS) continued promotion on the relevance of women on empowerment, gender equality, and issues confronting women in the agri-fishery sector, employees from the Philippine Council for Agriculture and Fisheries (PCAF) conducted a virtual screening and discussion on the film titled “Sol Searching” on July 2, 2021.
The film highlights issues and challenges being faced by women, how they responded to these issues that feature the rights and roles of women, as well as the role they play in our society.
The story revolves around Sol Dolores, a grade school teacher who teaches farming in her community. When Sol died, her family went the extra mile to source out fundings for her burial. Aside from issues and concerns in gender and agriculture, the film also underscored various problems in the society faced by Sol and how she brought change to her environment despite her misforgivings.
In her opening message, PCAF OIC Executive Director Julieta Opulencia thanked Pinoy Indie Films Road Show (PIFRS) for bringing quality films that not only promotes local film makers but also depicts the issues being faced by women in their families and society in a creative way.
Meanwhile, Karen Salutan- Founder/Owner of PIFRS Multimedia Distribution Services who was also present in the event thanked PCAF for providing an avenue where they can promote locally produced independent films.
“I am advocating the promotion of indie films because most of the time, they are underpromoted and unnoticed due to the boom of commercially produced films which have more funding and have famous actors and actresses as part of the cast,” Salutan added.
After the virtual screening, a question and answer session was conducted where PCAF employees shared their thoughts and reflections on the film which was followed by a closing message from Conchita del Rosario, representative of the GAD-FPS and OIC Assistant Chief of the Partnership Development Division.
In her message, del Rosario reminded the participants of the objective of GAD which is to empower the underprivileged, disadvantaged, marginalized, and vulnerable groups.

Write a 500-word creative story: “A Girl And Her Dog”

Write a 500-word creative story: “A Girl And Her Dog”

Here is your creative story:

A Girl And Her Dog

A girl and her dog were walking down the street one day, enjoying each other’s company. As they walked, the girl suddenly stopped and looked up at the clouds in the sky. “What are you doing?” asked the dog.
“I’m just watching the clouds and imagining things,” replied the girl.
The dog tilted its head and watched the clouds as well. Suddenly, he saw something in the clouds that looked like a shape. He barked and ran towards the girl.
The girl looked at where the dog was barking and gasped when she saw what looked like a face in the clouds.
“The clouds look like faces today!” exclaimed the girl.
The dog barked again and the girl started to make the shapes that she saw into objects. Soon, the two were making an entire scene in the clouds. They could see a car on a cloudy road and a tree in the distance.
The dog then jumped up on the girl’s shoulders and pointed to something else in the clouds. The girl looked where the dog was pointing and gasped when she saw the outline of a girl floating in the air.
“Can you see the girl in the clouds?” asked the girl excitedly.
“No, she can’t,” replied the dog sadly. “Only you can see her because she is just a reflection of you.”
The girl stared at the floating girl in the clouds for a moment before looking back down at the dog.
“Do you think I’m really special?” she asked.
The dog smiled and licked her face.
“Yes, of course you are,” he replied.

A simplified expression for line voltage is deduced to obtain voltage distribution characteristics conveniently and efficiently. Detailed voltage distribution characteristics along HWLT line are presented through analyzing its generalities and specialties respectively. Simulation results prove the accuracy of the proposed expression. The results also demonstrate that in some cases, the HWLT system affected by multiple non-ideal factors has more serious voltage security risks compared to single factor.

She always made time to help the poor and sick people, and was always doing something kind for others.

One day, the king and queen decided to host a big party. The whole kingdom was invited, and everyone was looking forward to the party, especially the lovely princess. It was going to be Lela's birthday party, and the celebrations were going to be very nice, with music and dancing, and the finest foods and drink the king's personal chef could prepare.

Unfortunately, the day before the party, Lela came down with a bad cold. Her mother, the queen, was very worried, because she knew it would be impossible for Lela to attend the party. And without Lela, the party would not be nearly so wonderful, as everybody would miss seeing her.

But Lela was a very brave and good-hearted girl, and as soon as she came down with the cold she thought about her people, and how much the party meant to them. She decided that she could not disappoint her people by being sick and missing the party. So she gave some medicine to her mother to help her get over her cold in time for the party.

The Chancellor, whose mother ran a catering company whilst his father ran a textile business, also outlined Government support for small businesses, referring to them as the ‘engine room’ of the economy.

“It is the aim of Gleave Media to help other small Devon businesses grow and achieve great things, so it was a real bonus to receive recognition for myself as well as get a glimpse inside the power house that is No 11,” he added.

Six semi-trailers are also required to move the accessories, such as bushings, coolers and other ancillary equipment, needed to complete each transformer once it is on site.
The latest on any road closures will be available by calling 511 or visiting MB511.ca. The move will begin at 8 p.m. tonight.

random_doc:
Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has launched 'Delhi Metro-SBI Card' on Friday in association with SBI Cards, India's largest bank issuing Pure Play Credit Cards.
The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has launched 'Delhi Metro-SBI Card' on Friday in association with India's largest bank SBI Cards (SBI Cards) issuing Pure Play Credit Cards. This multi-purpose card will be beneficial for the passengers of Delhi Metro in every respect. 'Delhi Metro-SBI Card' was jointly issued by Dr. Mangu Singh, Managing Director of DMRC and Ashwani Kumar Tiwari, Managing Director and CEO of SBI Card. Other senior officers of Delhi Metro and SBI Card were also present on the occasion.
Users will be able to use this multi-purpose card as a smart card with auto top-up facility when the card has less than Rs 100 left. Credit card facility will automatically recharge the top-up value of Rs 200 from the card or bank account linked to the user in the card. In addition, this combo card can also be used for all regular credit card transactions.
Speaking on the occasion, DMRC MD Dr. Mangu Singh said that, this effort is in line with DMRC's commitment to support the digital campaign to promote cashless transactions for the passengers of Delhi Metro, which is today one of the social distancing lives Has become a part. We believe that the 'Delhi Metro-SBI Card' will serve as an essential tool to make Metro travel safe in times of this epidemic.
On this occasion, Ashwini Kumar Tiwari, Managing Director and CEO SBI Card said that with the Delhi Metro SBI Card, we are bringing a unique value proposition to the market. With this card, millions of metro passengers will get an advanced opportunity for daily travel and they will also be able to get rewards in their daily shopping. We have tied up with DMRC to set up kiosks at 100 identified stations. Passengers will be able to apply for the Delhi Metro-SBI card at metro stations as well as apply online on the e-application platform of SBI Card portal.
In the recent past, DMRC has also introduced several other measures to avoid the time line for the sale of smart cards or tokens at stations and to save time. These include options for top-up smart cards through TVM, introduction of metro combo cadres in collaboration with other banks, net-banking, mobile wallet etc. using credit or debit card transaction facility at stations.

Write a 500-word creative story: The title of your story is: 'The Secret of the Black Box'
Once upon a time, there was an old man named James who lived in a small apartment in New York City. He was a retired engineer who had worked for NASA for many years and was well-known for his research on space exploration. One day, James received a letter from the government that changed his life forever.
The letter read: "James, we found your Black Box in the wreckage of the spaceship you built. We want to give it back to you for safekeeping." James was thrilled. He had been working on the Black Box for years before it went up in space, but it had never returned.
When he got the box, he couldn't believe his eyes. It was completely intact and looked exactly the same as when he had built it. However, he didn't know what it was for. He knew it had something to do with space exploration, but he didn't know what it contained.
He took it to a scientist named Dr. Smith who was an expert on space travel. Dr. Smith looked at the Black Box and said, "This is amazing! I've never seen anything like it before."
"What do you think is inside?" asked James.
"Well, I don't know, but I'm going to find out," said Dr. Smith. He opened the box and inside was a single coin. It looked like any other coin, except for one thing: the words "space exploration" were etched into it.
Dr. Smith was shocked. "How did this get here?" he asked.
James explained, "I built this coin specifically for the Black Box so that if anyone ever found it, they would know what its purpose was."
Dr. Smith was amazed by the fact that the Black Box had been recovered, but even more so by the fact that it contained a coin with words etched into it.
From then on, James became famous around the world for his discovery of the Space Exploration Coin. People would come from all over to see the coin and hear about James' story. And now, whenever anyone hears about the Black Box, they automatically think about the Space Exploration Coin and everything that it represents.
The End

The letter read: "James, we found your Black Box in the wreckage of the spaceship you built. We want to give it back to you for safekeeping." James was thrilled. He had been working on the Black Box for years before it went up in space, but it had never returned.
When he got the box, he couldn't believe his eyes. It was completely intact and looked exactly the same as when he had built it. However, he didn't know what it was for. He knew it had something to do with space exploration, but he didn't know what it contained.
He took it to a scientist named Dr. Smith who was an expert on space travel. Dr. Smith looked at the Black Box and said, "This is amazing! I've never seen anything like it before."
"What do you think is inside?" asked James.
"Well, I don't know, but I'm going to find out," said Dr. Smith. He opened the box and inside was a single coin. It looked like any other coin, except for one thing: the words "space exploration" were etched into it.
Dr. Smith was shocked. "How did this get here?" he asked.
James explained, "I built this coin specifically for the Black Box so that if anyone ever found it, they would know what its purpose was."
Dr. Smith was amazed by the fact that the Black Box had been recovered, but even more so by the fact that it contained a coin with words etched into it.
From then on, James became famous around the world for his discovery of the Space Exploration Coin. People would come from all over to see the coin and hear about James' story. And now, whenever anyone hears about the Black Box, they automatically think about the Space Exploration Coin and everything that it represents.
The End

random_doc:
I recently received notice from a major company that my personal information (SSN, DOB, address, etc.) has been compromised. As such, I would like to put a freeze on my credit. However, I have no credit history, and am not planning to start building one any time soon. Can I still have a freeze put on my (lack of) files?
Jurisdiction Note: I am in California.
Having no credit report is better protection than having a credit report with a freeze. If an identity thief applies for credit using your children’s information, the lender will get a response indicating no credit report exists with those identifiers, and also may receive an alert that the Social Security number belongs to a minor.
That being said, I'm not a minor - and I don't see any reason why a thief couldn't apply for credit just because I don't have a current credit report.
Some states now require that a credit report be created if none exists in order to add a credit freeze.
However, I have not been able to find any requirement for that in my state's credit laws.
Placing a freeze on your credit report will prevent lenders and others from accessing your Credit Report entirely, which will prevent them from extending credit. With a Security Freeze in place, even you will need to take special steps when you wish to apply for any type of credit.
Because of more stringent security features, you will need to place a Security Freeze separately with each of the three major credit reporting companies if you want the freeze on all of your credit files. A Security Freeze remains on your credit file until you remove it or choose to lift it temporarily when applying for credit or credit-dependent services.
That being said, if there is no Credit File for you, the reporting agencies might not be able to put a freeze on your credit as there is nothing to freeze.
Also, if there is no credit file generated yet for you, it's more likely that most of the applications for credit cards will get rejected. But it will be better to place an Initial Fraud Alert on your Credit.
Ask 1 of the 3 credit reporting companies to put a fraud alert on your credit report. They must tell the other 2 companies. An initial fraud alert can make it harder for an identity thief to open more accounts in your name. The alert lasts 90 days but you can renew it.
Not the answer you're looking for? Browse other questions tagged united-states credit-history fraud or ask your own question.

Write a 500-word creative story: It was a warm sunny day when 2 boys aged 8 decided to go for a walk. Their names were David and Steven and they were best friends. During their walk, they noticed a small shop and went to investigate. Inside the shop, they saw a very old and peculiar man. The man was very ugly, with one big black tooth. He had dark red hair and his clothes were not very clean.
The boys were curious and asked the man “what are you doing in this little shop?”.
“Oh I am selling rare gems! said the old man”.
The boys didn’t believe the man but wanted to have a look, so they asked the man to show them the gems. The man took a gem from a box and put it under David’s nose. “Can you smell any flowers?” he asked. David was amazed and said “Yes, it smells of roses”. The man continued to show the boys 10 gems, 5 for Steven and 5 for David. David’s gems smelled of violets, gerberas and a few other flowers, as well as Steven’s gems. The man asked David and Steven to guess how many gem’s they had. Both boys looked at each other and said “15”.
David and Steven ran home with their gems and David said to Steven “I think we should keep these gems hidden, we don’t know who this old man is”. Steven replied “yeah but I think we should use them. I heard once that when you smell a flower, it will stay in your pocket for 3 days and when you take the gem out, you will have as much time as you smelled to use your ability that you get from that flower!”. David wasn’t so sure but decided to try it out.
The next day, David went to the pet store and asked for a lizard. He smelled of violets and asked the clerk for 30 minutes. He told the clerk that his cat wasn’t eating and asked for a lizard. He bought the lizard, took it home and fed it to his cat.
The next day, Steven went to the pet store and asked for a snake. He smelled of gerberas and asked for 15 minutes. Steven told the clerk that his parrot was ill and asked for a snake. He bought the snake, took it home and fed it to his parrot.
The next day, Steven and David went to the zoo and Steven’s dad offered to drive

Write a 500-word creative story: 
The idea is very attractive to me.  I live in a semi-rural area and we have quite a few birds and squirrels that love to sit by our pond.  I love the idea of getting a pedestal bird bath for them.

I’m not very creative but I will try to put something together. 

I thought my story would be more of a short story, but it turned out being 500 words.  I hope it gives a little insight into our daily lives in the countryside of Maine.

The birds and squirrels are very much a part of our lives here at my home in Maine.  I’ve had a bird bath in my yard since I moved here 10 years ago and it’s always busy with activity. 

My husband and I decided to get one for Christmas this year and chose the pedestal bird bath because we thought it would be a little classier than the regular bird bath we’ve had for years.  It’s also more convenient to clean since you can easily lift it off the ground and wash underneath with water or just take it inside in bad weather.

Our first bird bath, which is now empty on the ground, is no longer used much by our feathered friends.  They prefer to land on the top of the pedestal bird bath and get a drink before continuing on their way.  It also provides a good resting place for the small birds in our area as they make their journey to the feeders on our property.

The squirrels love the pedestal bird bath too because they can climb up and down easily and enjoy a drink from the water feature.  In fact, when they aren’t eating seeds from our feeders, I often see them playing in the water and having a good old time. 

Our dog, who doesn’t like squirrels, has learned to stay away from the bird bath because he’s afraid they will sneak up on him while he’s sleeping in his dog house! 

He’s not too thrilled about the birds, either, since they often sit on top of his dog house roof and screech at him until he barks loudly enough for them to go away.  We’ve tried everything from pepper to mothballs to keep them away but nothing works. 

He can’t wait for winter when he’ll have to go outside for his potty break because there won’t be any squirrels or birds to scare him. 

I hope you enjoy this story about our little birds

random_doc:
Lately I’ve been publishing screencasts demonstrating how to use the tidymodels framework, from first steps in modeling to how to tune more complex models. Today, I’m exploring a different part of the tidymodels framework; I’m showing how to implement principal component analysis via recipes with this week’s #TidyTuesday dataset on the best hip hop songs of all time as determinded by a BBC poll of music critics.
First, let’s look at the data on the rankings.
As a first step, let’s recreate the plot from the source material, but adjusted a bit.
To see more examples of EDA for this dataset, you can see the great work that folks share on Twitter! ✨ Next, let’s get audio features from the Spotify API.
Spotify makes a set of “audio features” available in its API. This includes features like whether the song is in a major or minor key, the liveness, the instrumentalness, the danceability, and many others. One option to work with these songs would be to get them all at once via a playlist that Tom Mock made.
This would be perfect for exploring the audio features on their own. On the other hand, this is going to be pretty difficult to match up to the songs in the rankings dataset because both the titles and artists are significantly different, so let’s take a different approach. Let’s create a little function to find the Spotify track identifier via search_spotify() (Spotify has already handled search pretty well) and use purrr::map() to apply it to all the songs we have in our dataset.
At the end of that, there are 6% of songs that I failed to find a Spotify track identifier for. Not too bad!
Now that we have the track identifiers, we can get the audio features. The function get_track_audio_features() can only take 100 tracks at most at once, so let’s divide up our tracks into smaller chunks and then map() through them.
We have audio features! 🎉 Now let’s put that together with the rankings and create a dataframe for modeling.
How are these quantities correlated with each other?
Louder songs have higher energy, and older songs tend to be more danceable and have higher valence (i.e. be more “happy”).
Let’s train a linear model on these audio features.
We only have evidence for year being important in the critic ratings from this model. We know that some of the features are at least a bit correlated, though, so let’s use PCA.
We can use the recipes package to implement PCA in tidymodels.
## Training data contained 293 data points and no missing data.
Let’s walk through the steps in this recipe.
First, we must tell the recipe() what our model is going to be (using a formula here) and what data we are using.
Next, we update the role for title and artist, since these are variables we want to keep around for convenience as identifiers for rows but are not a predictor or outcome.
Next, we take the log of the outcome (points, the critic ratings).
We need to center and scale the numeric predictors, because we are about to implement PCA.
Finally, we use step_pca() for the actual principal component analysis.
Before using prep() these steps have been defined but not actually run or implemented. The prep() function is where everything gets evaluated.
Once we have that done, we can both explore the results of the PCA and then eventually use it in a model. Let’s start with checking out how the PCA turned out. We can tidy() any of our recipe steps, including the PCA step, which is the third step. Then let’s make a visualization to see what the components look like.
Let’s zoom in on the first four components.
y = NULL, fill = "Positive?"
So PC1 is mostly about age and danceability, PC2 is mostly energy and loudness, PC3 is mostly speechiness, and PC4 is about the musical characteristics (actual key and major vs. minor key).
How are the songs distributed in the plane of the first two components?
Older, more danceable songs are to the left.
Higher energy, louder songs are towards the top.
You can change out PC2 for PC3, for example, to instead see where more “speechy” songs are.
How much variation are we capturing?
And finally, let’s fit the same kind of model we fit before, but now with juice(ranking_prep). This approach really emphasizes how recipes can be used for data preprocessing. Notice how juice(ranking_prep) has already taken the log of points, has the component values ready to go, etc.
So what did we find? There is some evidence here that older, more danceable, higher valence songs (PC1) were rated higher by critics.

Write a 500-word creative story: It was a long, winding road that the three best friends took to reach the destination of their dreams. “I still can’t believe we’re doing this,” said Kevin, as he climbed over the final stretch of the last mountain. “Me either,” said Ryan, who was right behind Kevin. “It just seems like yesterday that we decided to embark on this journey together.” The third friend, Brandon, was a little too far behind to hear what was being said between Kevin and Ryan, but he knew that the feeling was mutual. “Yes, and we’re almost there,” added Brandon. “It’s just around the corner.” Suddenly, out of nowhere, a huge boulder came rolling down the mountain, and Brandon screamed in fear. “That’s not good,” muttered Kevin. “What do we do now?” “We’ll just have to keep going,” said Ryan. “There’s no time to stop and think about what happened. We must persevere, like we’ve always done.” And with that, the three best friends continued on their journey, even though it meant climbing down a steep cliff that seemed to go on forever.

When the friends finally reached the bottom of the cliff, they looked at each other and laughed. “We made it!” exclaimed Brandon. “Yes, we did!” added Kevin. And with that, the three best friends turned around and headed towards their destination – the spot where they would build their treehouse. And as they walked, they talked about what the treehouse would look like, and how they were going to decorate it. “Let’s make sure there’s a place where we can go to think about life,” said Brandon. “A quiet corner, if you will.” “Of course!” said Kevin. “There will be a reading nook, too,” added Ryan. And so it was settled. When the treehouse was finished, Brandon, Kevin, and Ryan sat down in the reading nook and started thinking about the meaning of life. As they sat there, a gust of wind blew through the window, and a piece of paper flew through the air. “What’s this?” said Kevin. “It’s a letter,” replied Brandon, who was already starting to read the words on the page. “And it says…” “To the three best friends in the whole world,” said Brandon. “Well,” said Kevin. “That’s interesting.” “Well, read it, you guys,” added Ryan. “

random_doc:
Am I the only person who has found it very hard to discover what the price of Quicken membership will be for the coming year? I received an email advising me that I would be charged next month - but the email and the linked FAQ avoid saying what the cost will be. This must be a strategic choice made for marketing reasons - but it is a very unhelpful one.
The price that will be charged when your subscription renews depends on which edition of Quicken you have...I believe there are 10 of them. Regardless of which edition you are running, the renewal charge will be for the annual retail price.
Perhaps the easiest way to see what you will be charged is to log into your Quicken.com account and click on Subscriptions. Or alternately from within Quicken go to Help > Manage Your Subscription > My Quicken Account > Subscriptions. It will show your annual subscription cost there.
You can see the retail prices for the various editions at https://www.quicken.com/product-selector/reverse-nst. The prices shown there are the monthly cost but you will be charged for the annual cost so multiply the monthly cost by 12.
You will sometimes see 2 monthly prices shown there. The lower prices generally are for new subscribers only. Existing subscribers will pay the non-discounted retail price (i.e., the crossed out one).

You will sometimes see 2 monthly prices shown there. The lower prices generally are for new subscribers only. Existing subscribers will pay the non-discounted retail price (i.e., the crossed out one).

How to escape from Cheque bounce case?
Meet Cheque Bounce Lawyers Near You for Bounced Cheque case, It comes under Section 138 in The Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881. The dishonor of cheque is a criminal offence and is punishable by imprisonment up to 2 years or with monetary penalty or with both.
According to Section 13 of the Negotiable Instrument Act, 1881, Negotiable Instrument means a promissory note, bill of exchange or Cheque payable either to order or to bearer. A negotiable instrument may be made payable to two or more payees jointly, or it may be made payable in the alternative to one of two, or one or some of several payees.
Section 138 provides that when the Cheque is dishonored for insufficiency of funds or for any of the prescribed reasons, the one who is at defaulter can be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine which may extend to twice the amount of the cheque, or both.

Write a 500-word creative story: The story could be about anything you want. It can be imaginary, funny, scary, sad or even a bit of everything. You can use first person or third person point of view. There is no right or wrong story. Have fun writing your story!
The following story is inspired by my previous post:

Siri, What’s The Time?

It was two forty-five at night and I was looking for my phone to check the time because my friend’s WhatsApp message notified me that she was outside the school gate and wanted to go for a walk. I was half-sleeping when my friend called me, so I didn’t hear her the first time she contacted me.
My phone was lying face down on the coffee table when I got up to look for my phone. There was this one time when my phone had fallen under the dining table and it took me an hour to look for it because it was lying face down. I knew that my phone was on the coffee table, but I couldn’t see it because of the angle. After many times of trying to peer from above, I finally saw it under the coffee table and I was so relieved. That incident had taught me to make sure that my phone was in a position that I could see it from above before I slept.
I looked up, and my phone was lying face down in its usual position next to the TV remote control and the charger. I decided to put my phone back into the holder that hung on the side of my bed, because it was nearer than the coffee table. I could just touch the phone and I could see it from above. My bed was on a high level as well. Then I heard the phone ringing and it was a text message notification telling me that my friend was outside the school gate. I picked up the phone and dialed her number, not realizing that it was lying face down.
After we had a nice conversation, I told my friend to go home as I would see her tomorrow and hung up. I checked the time and my phone was displaying the right time. I was relieved. I checked my phone to see if there was any missed call and it showed my friend’s number displayed. There was a call notification as well. I sighed in relief and placed my phone back into the holder. I checked the time again and my phone was displaying the right time.
It happened again. I dialed my friend’s number and it did not go through. I checked the time again

random_doc:
Last year I started sewing with fleece, it is a fantastic and versatile fabric. I love how it doesn't fray, has a little bit of stretch to it and it is lovely and warm. I have blogs to share in the future about a hot water bottle cover and some cosy hats but today's post is about a puppet I made as a Christmas present. The gift was for one of the recipients of the taggy owl which shows just how much time flies!
I like puppets as they make fun gifts and my daughter always likes to receive them.  I like puppets with shaped heads, in the past I have made them with flat faces and they were not as effective, I found a fantastic pattern by Pauline McArthur in October's Australian Homespun magazine. I subscribed to Australian Homespun last year and found a lot of lovely projects and inspiration. I was unsure about it at first as it was an e-subscription through Zinio but I really enjoyed getting the e-mail every month. I also found that the patterns were easy to download when needed, and it means you only have to store the patterns you use. The October Issue was my favourite as it was the annual kids' special issue.
Panda Puppet - Pauline McArthur design from Australian Homespun.
The puppet design I used was for a family of puppets with their own accessories although I chose to just do one, The design is great, it is fully lined and has a padded head. It is easy to follow with loads of photographs and a really clear cutting layout. The pieces come together really well and it is easy to line up seams to give a better finish. It took me a little while to get my head around how to insert the lining and leave the gaps for fingers. The padded head works really well and helps give the face an expression. As with the puffins and oystercatchers adding the eyes after the head is padded gives a better position and finish. Having the blue eyes is a lovely feature and makes them look really friendly. I love the idea of accessorising the pandas but decided to give mine a bow tie instead of a tie or a bag. I am unsure about who liked it more, the little boy I sent it too or his parents who got to demonstrate.
You've done a sensational job on this puppet Joanne.

Write a 500-word creative story: 1000 words.

Output: In the last five years, I have been a lot more adventurous when it comes to making garments. I have made jumpers, tops, shorts, dresses, skirts, bags, a hat, mittens, gloves, a cushion and more but I think the thing that gives me the most satisfaction when I make are the puppets. My daughter has made a few and they always bring a smile to her face. I always look forward to making one, they are like a crafty, warm up, before making one of my favourite items to make a pair of fingerless mittens. The puppet is a great gift as a lot of the time it is the parent that uses it and plays with it after the child falls asleep. I think the one we made as a family has been used the most in the last 24 hours by me, my daughter and my husband so I think it is a great present too. As I mentioned in my last blog I've been looking into the history of puppets and puppet making for my blog this week. When I first saw the design in the Australian Homespun magazine I thought it was lovely but I did not think I would do it. I love the design because of how well the pieces come together with a padded head and well finished seams, I find it quite exciting to make. I started looking for a historical book about puppets and found this great one and I couldn't wait to get it. I loved it and got my first real understanding of how puppets work and have used my new knowledge to make a small puppet. It is made from wool as that is the only fabric I currently have on hand. The pieces come together really easily and is a great starter project if you don't already have the skills to make a puppet. I have only had 24 hours to play with my new toy but it has been used quite a bit and it is still in perfect condition. I think a lot of how well it has stood up is because of the quality of the fabric. My next project might be to try and make it a little more complicated, I'm thinking about making a dragon for my daughter, dragons seem to be her favourite animal at the moment. I need to go and search the internet for a better pattern, she loves puppets and she has a few but she gets tired of all the ones she has and is always ready for a new one. I also need a better looking

To find the remainder of 7 modulo 1000, I can use long division or see that 7 is congruent to 700 modulo 1000, since 700 - 7 = 693, and 693 is divisible by 1000. This means that 7 has the same remainder as 700 modulo 1000, and I can write $7 \equiv 700 \pmod{1000}$. This also means that $7^n \equiv 700^n \pmod{1000}$ for any integer n. Now I just need to find the remainder when 700 is raised to the 2013th power modulo 1000. random_doc:
Writer Adam Gopnik will speak about the state of spirituality at the Cardin Memorial Lecture.
Adam Gopnik believes there’s more than one way to rationally examine the world around us.
The annual lecture, established in 1986 by the Cardin family, examines topics pertinent to the Jewish and Christian traditions. Past speakers include the late writer Chaim Potok, political activist and philosopher Cornel West, author and editor Susannah Heschel, historian Taylor Branch and author Stephen Greenblatt.
Dr. Mark W. Osteen, director of Loyola University Maryland’s Center for the Humanities, which hosts the Cardin lecture, says Gopnik’s subject matter is particularly relevant in the current political and social climate.
If there’s something distinctive about the Judaism he grew up with, Gopnik says, it’s the argumentative tradition that developed over two millennia of debating the fine points of Torah and Talmud.
Just as argument and respect can coexist, Gopnik contends, so can such seemingly disparate subjects as science and religion.
In that same broadcast, Gopnik noted, “We constantly go back to the ethical systems and value systems that we’ve inherited, and we remake them. We interrogate them. We remake them to find values within them that give meaning to our lives and sense to our ‘generations,’ in the biblical sense. We may be, ultimately, in the universe on our own, but we are not on Earth newly born. We descend from long lines of people who’ve asked similar questions.
The 2018 Jerome S. Cardin Memorial Lecture will be held on Nov. 1, at 6 p.m., at Loyola University Maryland’s McGuire Hall, the Andrew White Student Center, 4501 N. Charles St. The event is free and open to the public. For information, visit loyola.edu/join-us/cardin-lecture. Registration is required.

random_doc:
Image compression emphasizing pixel size objects in midwave infrared persistent surveillance systems

Midwave infrared (MWIR) persistent surveillance systems typically attempt to maximize coverage area leading to designs that push the limits of resolution. This places few pixels on target and can lead to performance challenges related to high spatial frequency content. This is especially true of pixel sized objects in the imagery and the potential for small apparent temperature differences between these objects and local background causing low contrast. Further complicating the issue is the need to compress the imagery during transmission. Lossy compression effects from JPEG 2000 compression were examined to determine the effects on pixel sized objects in the imagery. Furthermore, the optimum order of operations within the image processing chain necessary to preserve pixel sized object information in compressed imagery is investigated. Applying unsharp masking prior to 14-bit JPEG 2000 compression followed by decompression produced the best results at maintaining the integrity of pixel sized objects at compression ratios up to 40∶1 based on visual interpretation of the imagery.

full_output:
Image compression emphasizing pixel size objects in midwave infrared persistent surveillance systems

Midwave infrared (MWIR) persistent surveillance systems typically attempt to maximize coverage area leading to designs that push the limits of resolution. This places few pixels on target and can lead to performance challenges related to high spatial frequency content. This is especially true of pixel sized objects in the imagery and the potential for small apparent temperature differences between these objects and local background causing low contrast. Further complicating the issue is the need to compress the imagery during transmission. Lossy compression effects from JPEG 2000 compression were examined to determine the effects on pixel sized objects in the imagery. Furthermore, the optimum order of operations within the image processing chain necessary to preserve pixel sized object information in compressed imagery is investigated. Applying unsharp masking prior to 14-bit JPEG 2000 compression followed by decompression produced the best results at maintaining the integrity of pixel sized objects at compression ratios up to 40∶1 based on visual interpretation of the imagery.
Write a 500-word creative story: The story should unfold through the characters interactions, decisions, and the consequences of their actions. Aim to weave in common sense lessons and social cues. The narrative should cater to a diverse age group, including at least one dialogue and presenting both positive and negative outcomes.
Do not start with classic sentences like "Once upon a time", be creative. Once a group of friends decided to create a small business selling handcrafted candles. They worked tirelessly to find the perfect combination of scents and colors for their candles, and once they had the designs finalized, they got to work making them. The candles were a hit with customers, but soon enough, they started to notice a problem - they couldn't keep up with demand.

One day, while discussing the issue over lunch, one of the friends suggested using JPEG 2000 compression on their photos of the candles to save space on their website. At first, everyone was opposed to the idea since they wanted to show off all the beautiful detail of their creations. However, after some discussion, they agreed to give it a try.

They spent hours testing different compression ratios until they found the sweet spot where the images still looked great but took up less storage space. Finally, they felt ready to implement the new compression technique.

As soon as they uploaded the newly compressed photos to their website, they noticed something strange. Their pixel-sized objects - the wicks, labels, and candle holders - seemed blurrier and more difficult to identify than before. This realization hit them hard because they knew that customers relied on seeing those details to make a purchase.

Determined to fix the issue, they started experimenting again, trying various combinations of image processing steps. Eventually, they discovered that applying unsharp masking before compressing the image significantly improved the appearance of the pixel-sized elements. Although there was still room for improvement, this solution helped them strike a balance between efficiency and quality.

Throughout this process, the friends learned valuable lessons about compromise and understanding the needs of their audience. They also realized that sometimes going back to basics can lead to unexpected solutions. In the end, their dedication paid off as more people than ever before fell in love with their candles. And although the pixels may have appeared a bit fuzzier in the images, they couldn't deny that success made up for any slight imperfections.

random_doc:
Some fans asked me if I was selling some of my gear at the last Shimmer events so I decided to sell a bunch of stuff.
I already had some stuff on sale on my website and MySpace but there is more now.... I have so many costumes that I need to get rid of some stuff.
Also, if there is an outfit that you would like to buy that is no on sale, let me know anyway. If I get a good price, I might sell it anyway. I would love to sell at least half of my stuff.... I have way too many things!
Plus, I got the bill for my nice scar against ODB... Let me tell you that I really need to sell a lot of things... So any help would be MUCH APPRECIATED!!
So sorry you had to get the bill...OUCH!!!!!
See, this is why we need socialized medicine in the US . . . so poor LuFi doesn't have to sell off her gear every time she gets hurt.
Doesn't she live in Canada, though?
It depends on where the match took place?
Yes, but she works frequently in the US. I believe that the match with ODB was here, and I'm assuming she got the stitches here instead of waiting to go back north of the border.
So, if I get injured in Canada and have whatever procedures done there, do I get the perks of their Socialism? Without being a citizen, I would think not. Being a Canadian citizen and living there, shouldn't where an ailment occurred be irrelevant?
Being a Canadian citizen and living there, shouldn't where an ailment occurred be irrelevant?
If you get treated in the US, the US institution will bill you, regardless of what kind of health care program backed by a foreign government you're participating in.
It makes you wonder why Canadian wrestlers would bother getting treated here, then. In LuFisto's case, her head was cracked open and that couldn't wait.
I do wonder if the same applies with American citizens getting treated in Canada.
No clue on that one, and I'm not about to go hurt myself in Saskatoon to find out.
And, yeah, there are foreign people who get injured in the US and forgo treatment until they get back home so that they don't have to pay. An organization that I'm a member of here in my hometown sponsored a foreign exchange student from Slovakia, and he destroyed his knee playing indoor soccer. We obviously had to inform his parents, who wanted him on the next plane back so that he could get the surgery performed for free courtesy of their government.
It would've cut his stay in the US short by several months and he didn't want that to happen (nor did we), so we actually took up a collection to pay for the portion of the surgery which was not covered by the insurance we already had on him. The parents were suddenly fine with him staying.

"Sam, I'm going to keep this simple. No matter what I tell you, you're not going to believe me."

I finished my sandwich and took a long, deep drink of my soda. "Why not eat?"

I shrugged, trying to act like I didn't know. "I am. I'm worried about a lot."

I shifted nervously in my seat. I looked down at my feet, not sure what to do or say.

Write a 500-word creative story: "The Touch Tool." Use your creativity to add some fantasy into a tale about touch. The hero can use the engraved Touch Tool to touch someone to give them some sort of super power or ability. The hero can accidentally turn into a dragon or fly into space or be turned into a giant or get the ability to breathe fire or talk to plants and animals. Or, the hero can have someone he/she wants to turn into a hero (or villain) touch the tool. The hero could turn his/her best friend into a dragon or maybe the hero will accidentally turn his/her enemy into a giant and have to run away from him/her.
